title: Please unban my account, overall behavior system is WAAY too harsh i think
body:
I recently had the 14 day ban from those previous reports i recall saying some shit but theses here towards this perma ban is just plain over excessive. Ive seen FARRRR nastier remarks then the ones listed below. Making me believe i am within a 00.6% or w.e is straight bullshit there are far more toxic players out there than ME. That was the first thing i wanted to say, the second being i don't talk in my games, i do not go into the games with an attitude or go in LOOKING for problems. The games where i do alot of typing is if i am questioning something i am witnessing during match that doesn't sit well with my eyes. I was currently playing gold elo, you know these matches get heated so why is the punishment so severe for this shit? the curses, the remarks, this language surrounds people 247 were ever people co exist. You can never eliminate toxicity and you also cannot try to tell me switch my behavior if i go into these matches with a clean fresh slate to begin with. Something simply happens that i would be believe to be bs or unfair not just me dying but that actual ludicrousness behind the events that LEADS to my death for an example. Otherwise i shut my yap and i commuinutcate thru pings if im gold , that should let you know as a PLAYER im just trying to win and get into higher elo to get BETTER i do not look for problems. 

I bought skins on this account, i have elemental lux on this account.
It takes very loooong time to get to lvl 30 
And if banned players are simply allowed to make new accounts, what lesson are you trying to teach here? it leads unto a never ending pattern. Sure overall toxcicity might be leaned out but still, you cannot allow players behind a screen to play victim 247 ina match whereas afterwards nothing interesting happens in the real world. My toxicity which is probably below average from other shit ive seen which just effects nothing in peoples lives afterwards.

Do we exchange phone numbers? do we talk after the matches? NO we move on to the next match how is it that this crap is taken SOO seriously like riot its time for a reality check

People are human beings i can be the nicest person at work.. but in league im some criminal behind bars??? cmon take psychology and re look into human behavior.. people will ALWAYS have something to say !

>i do not go into the games with an attitude or go in LOOKING for problems.

No one is suggesting you do. What Riot is saying, however, is that the behavior you display when faced with adversity is not acceptable.

The mute button is not an excuse to verbally abuse or harass others (something chat is not meant to be used for anyways) and is meant to be a band-aid solution at most. If you can't interact with others without forcing them to mute you then you're doing something wrong. Besides, choosing to type and press Enter/Send is still technically an ACTION you're choosing to take. You don't have to type out or even send your insulting and hate filled messages, but if you do then remember you chose to do so.

Yes we're not face to face but we're still interacting with real people, and anonymity is no reason or excuse to ignore all common sense and basic human decency. If you don't like being held accountable for your behavior online too bad, you can either suck it up and deal with it or just stick to single-player games/content.

P.S. To quote [Umbral Regent]( https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/bIQEEAVN-perma-bans?comment=0000): 

>If you got your main account permanently banned, the only way you can prove your reform is to not get any further accounts banned.

>Riot isn't going to give you infinite chances, they have to put their foot down somewhere - and that somewhere happens to be after the 14-day ban. If you can't be bothered to listen to three separate warnings _at the very least_, then, why should your main account be given a fourth try? You've already proven three separate times that you don't care about the rules.

>My opinion is that if you're worth getting your account back, you wouldn't have gotten it banned in the first place.

The game's rating is because there are scantily clad champions (men and women), violence, blood, smoking, alchohol, etc. The rating has **nothing** to do with player communication. That is covered by the rules. You are not allowed to flame your team game after game and expect no consequences. You don't get special treatment because you bought Elementalist Lux. Spending money is not a free pass to break the rules.

You decided after your 14-day suspension that having diarrhea of the keyboard was worth more than keeping your account. Here you are.

Im not saying i shouldn't be punished entirely im saying the punishments are way too severe perhaps another chat ban before the straight up perma ban? i can just make another account and all this creates is frustration. I will make a new account and eventually i will get pissed at some match at some point in time.. what did riot achieve here? absolutely nothing. It also discourages me from purchasing skins in the future as well, i get no refund and im treated like i committed a crime, what agency is they're for any player being HUMAN.

You didn't get a "straight up perma ban." You had 3 previous punishments each with a chance to improve your behavior. You **chose** not to. 

> i get no refund

Why would you get a refund? You consumed a service and enjoyed your purchase. If you get kicked out of restaurant, you don't get reimbursed for the money you spent. You ate the food.

> It also discourages me from purchasing skins in the future

A permanent ban is supposed to discourage you from playing **period**. Riot has shown you the door. You are not Riot's target customer, since you can't abide by the rules and you ruin the experience for others in your games. I know that sounds harsh, because it is. Nobody in your games should have to put up with the negativity that comes spewing from your fingertips.

> like i committed a crime

A crime? No. But you broke the rules. Breaking rules has consequences.

> being HUMAN

Being human, and more importantly being a **good human being** is following the rules when you're in someone else's house (in this case, Riot's) and treating other people with respect. You want a free pass for your behavior for being **human**, and news flash - no situation in life works like that.

If you want to behave with impunity, do it in your own home, in a single-player game, or make your own MOBA where you can have the rules exactly as you want.

So if we are going to try league as a sport stop rewarding people for being bad and these reports as well always make the other person seem the victim when you cannot nobodies else's chat but mines here.

If you want to be matched with better players, improve your skill and you will climb.

You don't get to flame people for doing poorly.

> We have to reward people for being bad Ina serious competitive game?

The reward for winning is climbing in rank. The reward for losing is dropping in rank.

Bottom line, this is a video game. It's not a serious anything. In 1, 5, 10 years, your imaginary rank in a video game is not going to matter to your life. Put things into perspective. You are not allowed to verbally abuse everyone you encounter in a video game just because you suffer from what I like to call "ZOMG IT'S RANKED" syndrome. Ranked or not, it's still just a video game, and as long as people are playing within the confines of the rules (which you violated), they can play however they see fit.

The level of seriousness that you take the game does not give you the right to shit on anyone else's fun.
